definition: meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)

sentences.english: Most part of China can observe this wonderful event.
sentences.chinese: 中國大部分地區可觀看到這個天象奇觀。

sentences.english: Such events, which only blot out the middle of the Sun, are known as annular eclipses.
sentences.chinese: 像這樣，太陽中部被遮蓋的天象，就叫做日環食。

sentences.english: The ceiling was done up planetarium style--a black sky with star constellations.
sentences.chinese: 天花板屬於天象儀風格，黑色的天穹上點綴着星座。

sentences.english: Meteor shower is one of the most romantic spectacle Sky.
sentences.chinese: 流星雨是最富浪漫色彩的天象奇觀。

sentences.english: Junqi astrology, as part of qi divination in ancient Chinese astrology, has very early origins.
sentences.chinese: “軍氣佔”屬於中國古代天象佔中的氣佔，起源甚早。

sentences.english: Their religion was highly influenced and supported by careful observations of the sky.
sentences.chinese: 他們的宗教高度受到對天象的詳細觀測的影響。

sentences.english: In addition to the church, the Jesuits erected two smaller buildings, an astronomical observatory and a library as part of the complex.
sentences.chinese: 此外還建造天象臺一座和圖書館數間，規模都不很大。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
constellation (arch., now 星座)/one of the 28 constellations of traditional Chinese astronomy and astrology/motion of stars since one's birth (predetermining one's fate in astrology)
mystery known only to heaven (archaic)/inscrutable twist of fate/fig. top secret
sun, moon and the five visible planets
